Text:
Am i seeing this r8??
2800 kbps bitrate!!! wow,amazing man..

Yeah, it's a short movie, so the file size didn't suffer from it. Movies that have a lot of grain due to the type of film they were shot on require higher bitrates to right, because grain EATS bits. I use 2250 for normal, modern, non-grainy 1080p sources and 2800kbps for high grain. I increased my normal bitrate on Beasts of the Southern Wild, Clerks, and Pi because they were all high-grain as well. This is something I don't see other encoders doing, and they should be.
Thanks for sharing this flick and i am seeding as usual :)

thnx for the info...learned a lot!!! good to know that u r flexible.. :)
i noticed this thing in the Pi movie as well(as u mentioned), now i know the reason!!! Good choice as usual...
Thank you so much for this. I have a 720p copy of this at 3.5G. Now I can replace it.
